title: State of the Season: Mid-season followup

replies.body: {{champion:33}} ok
{{champion:33}}

it might not be great but it is better than his old one were

* your Voidlings were pointless

* you only job was farming and making picks with R 

* and you simply waited with E
Do you realize that points 2,3 have not changed? His play style is pretty much the same except he can now mass spawn voidlings and clear jungle/epic monsters more quickly.
yes but his shield gives him clear weaknesses (poke)  and he can now go in and participate in a team fight
His shield is not his "weakness." His shield is a huge buff from pre-patch that now allows him to actually do something out of lane.
Oh yeah, because Malz definitely doesn't use his W at all. What a useless ability, right?

Honestly, my biggest problem with new Malz isn't even his passive, or his damage.
Its that if he grabs any spell vamp - good luck fighting him.
Technically spellvamp doesn't exist anymore
Yeah but I wish they would put SOME SORT of a vamp item back in such as they had with the hextech, It is fun to play a vlad/morde with vamp quints and build a healthy amount of vamp. but now its meh.

They removed spellvamp and replaced it with a %return by damage dealt. Because it would moreover be successful in hybrid champions. I feel they should put a small %return on the revolver as compared to the current lightning on hit effect, as it is nearly useless in the champions that build it.
spell vamp doesnt exist anymore stupid
Morgana still has it, its existent you just can't get through items now.
Gunblade is amazing for Malz. Plus, if you're running AD Malz (so much more viable now that voidlings scale from total AD), Death's Dance + Gunblade is terrifying amounts of sustain.
It's a healthier playstyle, because he doesn't take damage.

"Some are still under assessment (Brand, for example looks reasonable but we just haven’t seen enough play on him yet to judge success or not)." yet according to http://champions.pickban.com/compare/10-54/Brand-vs-Malzahar brand has a 6.0% pick rate while Malzahar has 3.7%

{{champion:90}} You know how everyone has one champion they love playing with, well before rework malz was mine and now i dont play him because he has a weak dull gameplay and his visual wasn't a update more like a new champ, not something i liked
> **I still will not understand why people ban him now a days since he is literally a joke**
I mean, he does still have a 57% win rate in mid.

"So I see that {{champion:13}} is getting Another FULL REWORK."
-{{champion:83}}
It's not another. This one is much larger than the others, or so they say. But yeah, Ryze is getting as much reworks as fucking Skarner. Speaking of which, Skarner is bound to get another rework.
Before {{champion:83}}
who is this {{champion:83}} ... is he a new champion? {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

Why is there no "Fixing Dynamic Queue" in there?

Or how about "listening to community feedback and bringing Solo Q back"?
Or actually pay attention and accept that Solo Queue is gone?
That was in the Ask Riot thing.  Solo Q isn't coming back, but they are gonna make tweaks to Dynamic queue to balance how it patches together players.

> [{quoted}](name=Gamebird8,realm=NA,application-id=Ag8jgd8Q,discussion-id=pZ8AdFyE,comment-id=00170001,timestamp=2016-06-08T18:11:06.439+0000)
>
> That was in the Ask Riot thing.  Solo Q isn't coming back, but they are gonna make tweaks to Dynamic queue to balance how it patches together players.

So far their solution was to bring Autofill to Diamonds+. And the Pro-players decided to switch to private servers... So I don't think Riot knows what they are doing.

I don't get why people want SoloQ back so badly. The only reason I can think of is that maybe your just unhappy about your rank and want to go through provisionals again to maybe obtain a higher rank. Besides that I don't see why people care. I personally enjoy the new DynamicQ due to being able to queue up with more then one friend and because of the fact that we can now add teammates along the way. For example, lets say I am duoing with a support main as an ADC and we encounter a good jungler in one of our games, boom, we can add them to the queue and build up a team like that. Overall, I think DynamicQ is a very great addition to League and I think people are just salty that they can't start fresh again.

The main issue with DQ is that people are getting ranks they don't deserve. I've seen plenty of people in gold/plat and even diamond play to a level that does not fit their rank. When I looked up these players, the majority of them were bronze/silver last season. 
They've literally been queueing up with higher rank friends and getting to ranks that they don't deserve.

Tl;dr - The entire point of ranked was to get a sense of how good you were (your rank and mmr) and to improve and climb to higher ranks. With the introduction of DQ, rank =/= skill anymore. It's quite sad. actually.

it's reason like this that people want solo que back. not everyone wants to make a full group or maybe their friends aren't on at that time so they have to join DQ as a solo then they get a team of 5 solo players going against a team of 5 players on teamspeak which gives the players who joined together a huge advantage
Pros are more on private servers to have no queue times/only pro competition for training purposes. Remember their game schedule went from 2 games a week to a minimum of 4.

Read Bjergsen and Doublelift's tweet about DQ and how system is broken right now.
Doublelift had a game with 4 challenger + 1 master on one team and 4 diamonds + 1 master on the other team.
Bjergsen had a game where 2 players got roles that they didn't even pick.
It's not only because of queue time competitiveness.
The system itself is broken.

I logged on just to say I truly appreciate the future lay out patches to come. They may change, as is life. But just giving us a goal in mind of what to look forward too is really nice and speaks to how riot wants to communicate with its following.
**So no {{champion:83}} relaunch until preseason 7? {{item:3070}} {{summoner:3}}  {{item:3070}} **
I heard it was coming this year at some point; and that {{champion:6}}'s rework would be the first in 2017
So that makes {{champion:19}} the one to be reworked mid 2017?

warwick should come before urgot

his is actually ON the champion update list. urgot isnt
Yorick has been slated to come out this year and has been being worked on longer then Ryze, but Ryze's is smaller and thus faster out the door.

I agree that we need changes to how support grades are calculated, like for example, it's almost impossible to get an S on Janna unless you went 2/0/25, because she doesn't have a constant heal like Soraka or Nami, and she doesn't do damage like Lulu or Brand. It's really frustrating when I try to get an S on her for champion mastery, and I played really well, but I don't get a good grade because I didn't do damage or heal a bunch since most of Janna's kit is utility from her constant shielding and her disengage. Other supports also kind of feel this way and I think a change to that would help a lot, and I do realize that it should not by any means, be easy to get an S, but it shouldn't feel impossible.

I went 3/0/25 as Bard, A

not A +, just A.

im working on cheating the system gathering 5 players and go a full AP kill frenzy bard just to get my ranks. Because LOGICALLY HAVING A FIVE MAN PREMADE GIVES YOU 10% MORE MASTERY POINTS.

Makes sense you are CLEARLY BETTER WHEN PLAYING IN A PREMADE. -_-

Oh but when i got stuck as Mid braum and had a crappy 5/7/23 game, thats S+!
Its because it judges you based on how other people in your elo play the same champ in the same lane, people playing Braum mid were probably trolls, and you probably did much better than them.

What goes into grading system? How do you calculate it?

"It’s based on the champion and role that you just played in a game. So, for example, we look at Annie mid differently to Annie support. We take a series of performance metrics and compare how you do to all other players in your region in your champion / position combination. It is percentile driven - so earning a high score means you performed in the top x% of players on that champ in that position. The grade itself governs the point gains."

http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/page/features/champion-mastery

It's not that you're not getting good grade on Janna because you're not doing damage or healing but rather that a lot of other players who play Janna have high KDA, etc.
It overly favors kills/damage dealt even for supports. You basically need to be fighting the goals of the role, and build for damage and take kill intentionally to get a better shot at an S.

If what you're saying is true, how did I ever get S ranks on my Leona. And you're not getting the point of the answer Riot gave. It depends on champions/roles you're playing. If everyone is scoring 0.5 KDA on specific champion, you only need like 1.0 KDA to get an S. The point is, not everything is dependent on KDA/damage. It depends on how well you are doing RELATIVELY.

Janna is one of those champions that is easier to get higher KDA on, which is why pro-players ran Mejai on Janna because she can easily get assists without dying. Therefore, higher KDA doesn't mean as much compared to other high-risk champions like Leona.

complaining about supports a bunch, but what about the playmaker champs like gragas? how well ur doing on gragas can't be measured by numbers, for example a BAD gragas would gank lanes and take every kill and get an S then lose the game while a GOOD gragas would gank and set up a kill for his laners and then win the game with a B+ to A+
Still trying to get my Janna to level 7. =( You practically have to go deathless and get a few kills. Its pretty lame.
For the universal invulnerability thing, you could change the color+texture of the HP bar, maybe to a metallic style, to visually identify that "This champ cannot be damaged".
I think simply put, invulnerability should be a silver version of the "Zhonias hour glass" invulnerability. If you can move and are invincible, silver. If you cannot move and are invincible, gold.
